message: Hey Connor, thanks for hopping on. I skimmed your resume and you've bounced around a few sales environments. What originally pulled you into sales in the first place?
Yeah, for sure. It kind of just happened over time. I liked working with people and figuring things out as I went, and sales felt like a natural place where that made sense.
Got it. You mention being pretty proactive with pipeline management. How does that usually show up in your day-to-day?
I try to stay on top of things and not let stuff slip. It's more about checking in regularly and making sure there's always something moving forward.
Makes sense. You've worked both SaaS and more traditional sales rolesâ€”what feels different to you between those, or what did you enjoy more?
They're different in pace, I guess. SaaS was more ongoing, more relationship-based. I liked parts of both, honestly, just depended on the situation.
